The problem

Supabase Cloud charges $25/month + $10 per project.

3 side projects? That's $55/month.

5 projects? $75/month.

10 projects? $125/month.

You could self-host. But then you're on the hook for upgrades, backups, security, and debugging 12 Docker containers at 2am.

Most devs pick one: pay Supabase, or suffer.

How it works

You bring a VPS

Hetzner, DigitalOcean, whatever. $7-14/month gets you plenty of RAM for multiple instances.

We deploy Supabase

Full stack: Postgres, Auth, Realtime, Storage, Studio. Properly configured, secrets generated.

We handle the scary parts

Managed backups. Zero-downtime upgrades with rollback. Monitoring and alerts.

Support when you need it

Chat support for troubleshooting and questions. We're familiar with Supabase internals.

FAQ

What VPS specs do I need?

4GB RAM for 1 instance, 8GB for 2-3, 16GB for 4-6. Hetzner CX22 ($4/mo) works for a single instance.

How do backups work?

Hourly pg_dump to your S3/R2 bucket. You own your backups. We monitor and alert on failures.

How do upgrades work?

We track Supabase releases, test upgrades first, then push to your instance with automatic rollback if health checks fail.

What if something breaks?

Chat support for troubleshooting. We can help diagnose issues and guide you through fixes.

Do you have access to my data?

We have SSH access to manage Supabase, but your data stays on your VPS. Backups go to your bucket. We don't copy or access your application data.

What's included?

Postgres, Auth (GoTrue), Realtime, Storage, PostgREST, Kong gateway, and Studio dashboard. Edge Functions available on request.
